content.text:
# 1920 Rutgers Queensmen football team

The 1920 Rutgers Queensmen football team represented Rutgers University as an independent during the 1920 college football season. In their eighth season under head coach George Sanford, the Queensmen compiled a 2â€“7 record and were outscored by their opponents, 132 to 32. The team's two victories were against Maryland and Virginia Tech. The losses included games against Nebraska and West Virginia. Sanford was inducted into the College Football Hall of Fame in 1971.
